multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; Q3 2025 construction contract adds to US infrastructure spending, likely tightening US Treasury yields (esp. 10‑yr) and nudging inflation expectations.

category.motivation: The article reports new contracts for Skanska, which is a company news event.

impact.motivation: The article reports a new construction contract for Skanska, directly affecting its order bookings and revenue outlook for Q3 2025, indicating a positive business development.

time_frame.motivation: The article highlights long‑term construction pipeline developments that will influence Skanska’s future revenue and capacity, indicating a structural, forward‑looking impact.

article_node.title: Skanska secures $67m contract to construct new substation in US
article_node.summary: Swedish construction firm Skanska has won a $67 million contract to build a 27 kV enclosed substation on Governors Island, New York, a project that will support upcoming tenant developments and the New York Climate Exchange. The contract will be reflected in Skanska’s U.S. order bookings for Q3 2025, with construction slated to start later in 2025 and finish in 2027. Skanska also secured a $69 million contract for a health‑sciences facility in Durham, North Carolina, and a $249 million cable dehumidification project for the Verrazzano‑Narrows Bridge, all contributing to its growing U.S. construction pipeline.
